metadata.title: CVE-2022-3586 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s networking code. A use-after-freewas found in the way the sch_sfb enqueue function used the socket buffer(SKB) cb field after the same SKB had been enqueued (and freed) into achild qdisc. This flaw allows a local, unprivileged user to crash thesystem, causing a denial of service.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
